title: Java Collections Framework
subject: Java
theory:
A unified architecture for storing and manipulating groups of objects.
Unlike arrays, Collections grow dynamically.

**Hierarchy**:
Iterable -> Collection -> [List, Set, Queue]

common_mistakes.correction: `List l = new ArrayList();` is unsafe. Use Generics `List<String>`.

interview_questions.question: Does Map extend Collection?
interview_questions.answer: No. Map works on Key-Value pairs. Collection works on single elements.

real_world_use_cases.description: Keeping track of products (List), Unique Usernames (Set), Caches (Map).

exam_notes: Collection is Interface. Collections is utility class.
All collections work on Objects (Wrapper Classes), not primitives.
summary: This framework is the toolbox of every Java developer.
